extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 7.1: Why was George Washington unable to overcome division within the new government?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: POST 07 16

config.question: To which of these would Jefferson have given priority to counter Hamilton’s support for commerce?

answer_3.response: On almost every detail, Jefferson challenged Hamilton’s analysis. As secretary of state, Jefferson assumed that the strength of the American economy lay not in its industrial potential but in its agricultural productivity. The “immensity of land” represented the country’s major economic resource.
